statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: UMBC 67, Boston U. 63
article.story: CATONSVILLE, Md. (AP) -- Mike Housman had 20 points and eight rebounds and made 3 of 4 free throws in the final 19 seconds, and Maryland-Baltimore County rallied to beat Boston University 67-63 on Sunday. Brian Hodges added 19 points -- all in the second half -- on 7-of-9 shooting for the Retrievers (10-17, 6-8 America East), who snapped a four-game losing streak. Corey Lowe scored 19 points, and Carlos Strong added 15 for the Terriers (11-15, 8-6). Omari Peterkin scored 13 points, and Scott Brittain had 10 points and nine rebounds. BU led 32-31 at halftime and held a seven-point advantage on three separate occasions in the second half -- the biggest lead for either team. But with the Terriers up 47-40 with 13:27 remaining, the Retrievers went on an 8-0 run, including six points from Hodges, to take a 48-47 lead with 10:06 left. BU twice regained a four-point lead, but Hodges' jumper with 3:34 left gave UMBC the lead for good, and he extended the advantage to five on a 3-pointer with 1:32 remaining. Lowe hit a 3-pointer with 47 seconds left, but Strong missed a go-ahead attempt from beyond the arc with 21 seconds left and Housman buried two free throws. In the first half, UMBC led by five with less than five minutes remaining, but Lowe hit two quick 3-pointers to put BU back ahead. Lowe went 3-for-10 from 3-point range.
